column4: what's an "untrusted package" with respect to installing Ubuntu packages using aptitude?
it might mean that you are missing a gpg key
check the webpage of the repo for more info on how to add one
shouldn't all official packages utter this warning then?
I haven't seen this warning for the last 25+ packages I installed, and suddenly here it is. Doesn't seem logical to me.
that could be because not all packages come from the same section
or the same repo for that matter, assuming you have multiple repos enabled
I have no clue why but doing apt-get update helped.
although there was only a single non-official repo in my sources.list, but it is totally unrelated (VirtualBox)
it would have updated the gpg key...some repos change their keys at times...you key might have been old
still, if that was true, I'd have been required to ack the key, wouldn't IÃŸ
since you are updating, rather than adding
nevermind -- I'm not too much of an gnupg expert to assess the circumstances either.
Good Thing is, it works now.
no expert on gpg either...but thats usually the case
